page.title: 07SPALDING SLUICE GATES
page.content: The{Sluice gates }are needed to control the fresh {water level }and to prevent the tide from running through Spalding. The gates control the level of the water by lifting the doors on the sluice so that the water in the Coronation Channel runs out to the sea. The{gates}are made of steel and the base and walls are made of concrete. The{gates}are controlled either manually or by electric powered motors which move the gates up and down. { Mr A Newton}is responsible for the gates. He has to work regular hours. this is due to the tides and boats that may wish to come through the gates. There are three sets of gates in the area which operate together. The gates will still be needed in 20-50 years time.
